content:
• Wednesday, December 26, 2018
  • PSDO

    After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: PSDO +9.1%. ASNS +4.9%. TVIX +4.6%. MRNS +3.1%. M +1.6%.
    • Losers: APEN -10.7%. SUPV -6.4%. XOG -6.2%. CPG -5.3%. ERF -4.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 1 Comment

  • Big day for high-yield

    • With stocks melting upwards, Treasury yields rose modestly today, but junk yields fell thanks to narrowing spreads.
    • The iShares High Yield Corporate Bond ETF (HYG +1.7%), and the SPDR High Yield Bond ETF (JNK +1.7%)
    • Narrowing spreads also helped particularly roughed-up leveraged loan ETFs. Among them, the Invesco Senior Loan ETF (BKLN +1.6%) scored its largest one-day advance in more than seven years.
    • ETFs: HYG, JNK, OXLC, BKLN, ECC, DHY, HIX, EAD, PHT, HYT, HYLD, JQC, PPR, ACP, ANGL, CIK, EFR, BGB, MCI, DSU, VVR, SJB, KIO, NSL, BGX, PHD
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 18 Comments
  • PSEC

    Prospect Capital +1.5% on CEO share purchase

    • Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) CEO John Barry discloses acquiring 1M shares at the average price of $5.8717.
    • Prospect Capital shares are up 1.5% aftermarket to $6.19.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 63 Comments
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM signs new agreement with president

    • Sirius XM (NASDAQ:SIRI) enters into a new employment agreement with Scott Greenstein for his continued service as President and Chief Content Officer through May 24, 2022.
    • Greenstein's agreement includes a $1.6M base salary and an opportunity to earn a target annual bonus equal to 150% of his base salary based on performance. 
      • SIRI shares are down 1.9% aftermarket to $5.62.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 11 Comments
  • TCON

    Tracon +8.6% on positive test results

    • The company announces positive top-line results from the Phase 1b trial of TRC105 and Opdivo for the treatment of non-small cell lung cancer.
    • The combination was well-tolerated, says Tracon (NASDAQ:TCON). One patient developed a partial response and remains on study after 10 months. Two of the other five remain on trial with stable disease.
    • Patients are currently enrolling into two parallel 12 patient expansion cohorts, one that includes patients who have relapsed following prior PD-1/PD-L1 checkpoint inhibition treatment and one that consists of patients who have not received prior PD-1/PD-L1 checkpoint inhibition treatment.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Shares +8.6% to $0.63 after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • TSLA

    Musk tweets on European Supercharger availability

    • Elon Musk tweets that Tesla's (NASDAQ:TSLA) Supercharger coverage will extend to all of Europe next year.
    • The tweet responded to a user saying some Supercharger locations weren't available in Ireland.
    • Tesla shares are up 8.8% to $321.24.
    • Post updated to improve headline.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 307 Comments

  • Stocks (and oil) roar back - Nasdaq up more than 4%

    • About 40 minutes ahead of the close, the averages are on their way to erasing a few days worth of losses, with the Nasdaq ahead 4.1%, the S&P 500 3.2%, and the Dow 3.1%.
    • There are many stories, but the largest may be oil, up just shy of 10% to $46.51 per barrel.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 148 Comments
  • PLUG

    Microcaps dominate tech movers

    • Gainers: Plug Power (NASDAQ:PLUG) +26%. Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) +24%. Qutoutiao (NASDAQ:QTT) +21%. eGain (NASDAQ:EGAN) +19%. USA Technologies (NASDAQ:USAT) +16%.
    • Losers: FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) -20%. Marin Software Incorporated (NASDAQ:MRIN) -15%. VirnetX Holding (NYSEMKT:VHC) -10%. IZEA Worldwide (NASDAQ:IZEA) -10%. VirTra (NASDAQ:VTSI) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • SNY

    FDA approves Merck, Sanofi pediatric vaccine

    • The FDA approves Vaxelis, a pediatric hexavalent combination vaccine developed as a JV between Sanofi (SNY +0.2%) and Merck (MRK +2%).
    • The vaccine is indicated for active immunization to prevent diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, poliomyelitis, hepatitis B, and invasive disease due to Haemophilus influenzae type b in patients aged 6 weeks to 4 years.
    • The companies are working to maximize production to meet U.S. demand will a commercial launch happening no sooner than 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 8 Comments
  • CRBP

    Corbus Pharma, Neurometrix surge as H.C. Wainwright starts at Buy

    • Corbus Pharmaceuticals (CRBP +5.1%) and Neurometrix (NURO +14.9%) both jump after H.C. Wainwright initiates coverage with Buy ratings and respective $24 and $5 price targets (I, II).
    • Wainwright notes CRBP's lead compound, lenabasum, is a synthetic, oral, cannabinoid receptor type 2 agonist currently being evaluated in systemic sclerosis, cystic fibrosis, dermatomyositis and systemic lupus erythematosus.
    • With the thesis that CB2 is a critical component of resolution following inflammation, the firm expects significant read-through from one indication to the next.
    • The firm thinks at current prices any positive news from NURO could move the needle, with plenty of room for the stock to appreciate.
    • Importantly, as NURO rationalizes its distribution strategy by limiting Quell 2.0 to the highest profit margin channels of e-commerce, Wainwright expects gross margins to improve over the next couple of years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 6 Comments
  • GPS

    Gap to close Fifth Avenue store, part of plan to shut hundreds of locations

    • Gap (GPS +3.1%) is set to shut its massive NYC store on Fifth Avenue, CNBC reports, as the apparel retailer recently said it is considering closing hundreds of locations "aggressively" to focus on higher performing shops.
    • The reason for the specific closure is not disclosed, but the news comes as retail rents in Manhattan have been climbing over the past few years, although rents have started to cool off recently; the portion of upper Fifth Avenue between 49th and 59th streets in midtown where the Gap store sits saw rents drop 24% this fall, placing the average asking rent at $2,973/sq. ft.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • MB

    Analyst picks likely PE targets after Mindbody sale

    • D.A. Davidson downgrades Mindbody (NASDAQ:MB) to Neutral and moves the target from $33 to the acquisition price of $36.50.
    • On Monday, Mindbody announced it would be acquired by Vista Equity Partners for $1.9B.
    • Davidson analyst Nishi Jaluria says the firm long viewed Mindbody as an acquisition target particularly after this year's stumbles like the Booker acquisition.
    • The firm expects further private equity interest in software with (BLKB +5%), (BOX +5.3%), and (INST +5.3%) as the top targets.
    • Source: StreetAccount.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 12 Comments
  • DIS

    Disney warns Verizon customers of potential blackout

    • Deadline reports that Disney (DIS +3.3%) is airing ads for Verizon (VZ +0.9%) FiOS' 4.5M subscribers saying its stations could be blacked out starting next week if the companies can't reach a new agreement.
    • ESPN, Freeform, the Disney Channel and local ABC stations in New York and Philadelphia could go dark.
    • Sports are at the heart of the discussions with Disney's ESPN set to air two College Football Playoff semi-final games and an NFL wild-card playoff game in January.
    • Both companies tell Deadline they are optimistic about reaching a deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 47 Comments
  • USAS

    Chesapeake Energy and California Resources among energy/materials gainers; Kinross Gold and Seadrill Partners among losers

    • Gainers: Americas Silver (NYSEMKT:USAS) +23%. Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) +18%. Flotek Industries (NYSE:FTK) +16%. California Resources (NYSEMKT:CRC) +15%. Laredo Petroleum (NYSE:LPI) +15%.
    • Losers: Delta Technology Holdings (NASDAQ:DELT) -15%. Sanchez Midstream Partners (NYSEMKT:SNMP) -8%. Seadrill Partners (NYSE:SDLP) -7%. Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZOM

    Zomedica +7% on 80.9M share sale filing

    • Zomedica (NASDAQ:ZOM) files to sell 80,863,744 shares of common stock for selling shareholders. The company won't receive any proceeds from the sale.
    • Zomedica shares are up 6.8% to $1.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • RADA

    RADA +4% on CACS sale for $1.5M

    • RADA Electronic Industries (NASDAQ:RADA) will sell its ownership interest in Chinese equipment maintenance company CACS for $1.5M in cash.
    • The sale will result in a $1M loss from a discontinued operation in Q4.
    • RADA shares are up 3.9% to $2.68.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • MARPS

    Medallion Financial and Altisource Asset Management among financial gainers; X Financial and U.S. Global Investors losers

    • Gainers: Marine Petroleum Trust (NASDAQ:MARPS) +30%. Altisource Asset Management (NYSEMKT:AAMC) +16%. Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) +10%. Medallion Financial (NASDAQ:MFIN) +8%. West Bancorporation (NASDAQ:WTBA) +7%.
    • Losers: X Financial (NYSE:XYF) -12%. U.S. Global Investors (NASDAQ:GROW) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • ADIL

    Microcaps mostly among midday movers

    • Gainers: Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) +31%. Plug Power (NASDAQ:PLUG) +25%. Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) +24%. Verrica Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRCA) +22%. Altisource Asset Management (NYSEMKT:AAMC) +21%. XTL Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:XTLB) +20%. NF Energy Saving (NASDAQ:NFEC) +18%. Qutoutiao (NASDAQ:QTT) +18%. China Customer Relations Centers (NASDAQ:CCRC) +18%. ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) +17%.
    • Losers: MICT (NASDAQ:MICT) -23%. XBiotech Inc. (NASDAQ:XBIT) -16%. PLx Pharma (NASDAQ:PLXP) -15%. Netshoes (Cayman) (NYSE:NETS) -14%. Forterra (NASDAQ:FRTA) -13%. Lifetime Brands (NASDAQ:LCUT) -12%. ZIOPHARM Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP) -12%. Navios Maritime Acquisition (NYSE:NNA) -12%. Vaxart (NASDAQ:VXRT) -11%. RCM Technologies (NASDAQ:RCMT) -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • AEO

    American Eagle enjoys rising sales and margins, shares +11% in two days

    • American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +8.2%), which was a rare gainer in Monday's Christmas Eve stock market collapse, is higher again after Mastercard reported sales in this year's Christmas shopping season rose 5.1% Y/Y to $850B, the strongest in six years, with sales at apparel stores jumping 7.9% in the best gain since 2010.
    • Also sharply higher: ANF +6.1%, NKE +4%, RL +3.5%, GPS +2.5%.
    • Wedbush analysts say AEO is enjoying a holiday season with improving sales and gross margins, as "both core American Eagle and Aerie brands show record sales volumes on comparably less promotional activity with broad-based strength across the board."
    • The firm, which rates AEO at Outperform with a $25 price target, says "assortment focus on newness and accessories in holiday seems to resonate strongly with the consumer, and we see continued runway ahead for American Eagle into the new year."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM

  • S&P up 2% in post-Christmas rally

    • The averages are hard at work trying to erase Monday's ugly session. Just after noon, the S&P 500 is up 2.2% and the Nasdaq 2.8%. The Dow is up 2.1%.
    • Oil is ahead 6.5% and gold 0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 56 Comments
  • NBEV

    New Age Beverages leads consumer gainers; JAKKS Pacific and Vince Holdings among losers

    • Gainers: New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) +9%. DAVIDsTEA (NASDAQ:DTEA) +8%. YETI Holdings (NYSE:YETI) +8%. Fossil Group (NASDAQ:FOSL) +7%.
    • Losers: Lifetime Brands (NASDAQ:LCUT) -12%. Vince Holdings (NYSE:VNCE) -9%. The Lovesac (NASDAQ:LOVE) -6%. Youngevity International (NASDAQ:YGYI) -5%. JAKKS Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • XOM

    Oil prices rebound as some traders say slide is overdone

    • Crude oil prices, caught up in the wider weakness of the financial markets, are staging a recovery today amid perceptions that the recent slide may have been overdone: WTI +6.1% to $45.11/bbl, Brent +4.8% to $52.91/bbl.
    • WTI crude plunged below $43/bbl on Monday for the first time since June 2017 and has slid more than 40% since early October.
    • "There is a little bit of over-extension to the downside linked to global market fears," says Petromatrix analyst Olivier Jakob. "It's all about equities."
    • While economic worries have weighed, the oil outlook is not as weak as in 2016 when a supply glut built up because OPEC this time is trying to prop up the market, Jakob says.
    • Recent selling in oil "has felt less fundamentally driven and more a function of the overall market meltdown as increased equity volatility and growing macro concerns have weighed on a number of asset classes," according to analysts at Tudor Pickering & Holt.
    • Among today's oil and gas movers: XOM +0.5%, CVX +1.2%, RDS.A, +1.2%, BP +1.1%, COP +2.6%, APC +2.4%, NBL +2.6%, HES +2.9%, MRO +4.5%, MPC +3.2%, VLO +2.2%, PSX +2.9%, APA +1.4%, DVN +1.8%, PXD +2.8%, CXO +2.3%, EOG +1.8%, CLR +2.1%, CHK +14.2%, SWN +3.7%, RRC +1.7%, EQT +2.7%, OXY +2.2%, KMI +2.3%, EPD +1.9%, ET +5.3%.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 65 Comments
  • NOW

    Evercore: Cloud stocks gain in slower economy

    • Evercore ISI analyst Kirk Materne thinks cloud software stocks should gain in a slower economy since other companies can use cloud software to cut costs and drive growth.
    • The analyst mentions ServiceNow (NOW +2.4%) and Salesforce (CRM +2.5%) at Outperform and Workday (WDAY +3.5%) at In-Line.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • The First Trust Cloud Computing ETF (NASDAQ:SKYY) is up 1.3% to $45.86.
    • Other cloud-related movers: Twilio (TWLO +6.7%), Akamai (AKAM +1.7%), Intuit (INTU +1.4%), Adobe (ADBE +3.7%), Cisco Systems (CSCO +1.5%), RingCentral (RNG +4.7%), SendGrid (SEND +5.8%), Okta (OKTA +4.1%), Box (BOX +2.7%), Coupa Software (COUP +4.8%), Elastic (ESTC +3.8%), Shopify (SHOP +4.3%), Ceridian (CDAY +3.3%), Zscaler (ZS +4.2%), Splunk (SPLK +2.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 12 Comments
  • TSM

    Report: Huawei first to use TSMC's EUV

    • Huawei will become the first client to use TSMC's (NYSE:TSM) extreme ultraviolet process node manufacturing, according to China's Commercial Times via DigiTimes.
    • Chip subsidy HiSilicon will reportedly adopt the N7 Plus and N5 fabrication processes, which TSMC expects to hit volume production in 1Q19 and sometime in 2020, respectively.
    • Huawei is TSMC's second-largest client.
    • TSMC stock is up 1.3% to $35.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 10 Comments
  • ADIL

    EyePoint Pharmaceuticals and Sesen Bio among healthcare gainers; ZIOPHARM Oncology and Agenus among losers

    • Gainers: Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) +40%. XTL Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:XTLB) +16%. Sesen Bio (NASDAQ:SESN) +11%. ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) +8%. EyePoint Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:EYPT) +9%.
    • Losers: XBiotech (NASDAQ:XBIT) -17%. ZIOPHARM Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP) -12%. Agenus (NASDAQ:AGEN) -10%. Achieve Life Sciences (NASDAQ:ACHV) -8%. Axsome Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AXSM) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 5 Comments
  • DCTH

    Delcath announces commercial licensing agreement for CHEMOSAT®

    • Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +31.4%) has entered into a definitive licensing agreement for CHEMOSAT® commercialization in Europe with medac Gesellschaft für klinische Spezialpräparate mbH (medac).
    • Medac will pay Delcath €6M in a combination of upfront and success-based milestone payments. Additionally, Delcath will receive a fixed transfer price per unit of CHEMOSAT as well as royalties.
    • The agreement has a projected value of up to $45M over the first seven-year term and includes an optional five-year extension.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • IDEX

    Ideanomics signs mandate with NTS for City of Tianjin bus conversion financing

    • Ideanomics (IDEX +9.5%) has entered into an agreement with the National Transportation Capacity Co Ltd (NYSEMKT:NTS), as a specific financing mandate under the original framework agreement announced by Ideanomics in Aug. 2018.
    • This additional agreement is for the initial tranche of asset-backed financing and comes as a result of NTS finalizing a deal with the city of Tianjin, China's fourth-largest city, to re-finance existing asset-backed financing for electric bus conversion, valued at ~$8.25B.
    • This initial mandate from NTS is the first of several anticipated in the coming months under the 260B RMB framework agreement between NTS and Ideanomics.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • APRN

    Blue Apron bets its future on dieters in comeback bid

    • Blue Apron (APRN +2.3%) moves higher as it begins a new partnership with Weight Watchers (WTW +1.6%) that offers potential access to millions of customers interested in healthy eating.
    • APRN CEO Brad Dickerson tells WSJ the deal will help the company stabilize its customer count without having to spend tens of millions of dollars on advertising and promotions that have hurt its bottom line.
    • Dickerson says he believes the WW deal will help make APRN profitable next year.
    • The 83% YTD decline in APRN’s share price raises pressure on the company to show results or perhaps become delisted by the NYSE; the stock dropped below $1 earlier this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 7 Comments

  • Early rally attempt fails

    • The averages opened sharply higher, but the rally has mostly failed for now.
    • The Dow and S&P 500 have returned to flat, and the Nasdaq is up just 0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 28 Comments
  • SRPT

    Sarepta +2.5% on trial hold for competitor

    • Capricor Therapeutics earlier this morning announced a trial hold for its CAP-1002 treatment for Duchenne muscular dystrophy following a severe allergic reaction for a patient.
    • Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) +2.5% in early action.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Citron boosts Facebook; shares up 3.5%

    • "Backing up the sleigh," on Facebook (NASDAQ:FB), tweets Andrew Left.
    • Look past the rhetoric, he urges. "Would you rather have your kids addicted to Nicotine or Instagram? Wall Street answer will amaze you."
    • Full report here
    • His $160 price target suggests 30% upside from Monday's close. Shares this morning are up 3.5% to $128.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 46 Comments
  • ARW

    Ingram Micro sale could benefit these tech names

    • Raymond James analyst Adam Tindle says the potential sale of Ingram Micro could benefit public peers including Arrow Electronics (ARW +0.3%), Tech Data (TECD +1%), Synnex (SNX +0.7%), ScanSource (SCSC -1%).
    • Tindle sees HNA's possible $7.5B sale of Ingram to Apollo creating more rational pricing and competition.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • ADIL

    SFET, CHK among premarket gainer

    • Safe-T (NASDAQ:SFET) +36% on a purchase order for Safe-T's Software Defined Access solution.
    • Chesapeake Energy CHK +7% as Dunham discloses another big stock purchase.
    • New Age Beverages NBEV +7% on completing merger with Morinda Holdings.
    • Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) +6%.
    • Roku ROKU +6% on Needham "top pick".
    • Marin Software (NASDAQ:MRIN) +5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • MICT

    MICT among premarket losers

    • MICT (NASDAQ:MICT) -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy +7.5% as Dunham discloses another big stock purchase

    • Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) +7.5% pre-market after Chairman Archie Dunham disclosed the purchase of 2.1M shares worth ~$4.1M.
    • Dunham's Dec. 21 purchase, which averaged $1.965/share, was in addition to 2.4M shares he bought during Dec. 18-19 and brought his total CHK holdings to nearly 9.35M shares.
    • But the disclosure of the earlier purchases could not stop the stock's 9% plunge on Monday to close at $1.73, its lowest close since February 2016.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 37 Comments
  • NCLH

    Wedbush removes Norwegian Cruise from Best Ideas

    • Wedbush removes Norwegian Cruise Line (NASDAQ:NCLH) from its Best Ideas list citing "investment price discipline" but maintains an Outperform rating and a $65 target.
    • Last week, peer Carnival (NYSE:CCL) provided downside EPS guidance for Q1 and in-line FY outlook.
    • NCLH is flat premarket at $39.55.
    • Carnival shares are up 3.7% premarket and Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) is up 0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM | 5 Comments
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics +2% on expanding partnership with Johnson Matthey

    • Immunomedics (NASDAQ:IMMU) and Johnson Matthey (OTCPK:JMPLD) have expanded their long-term master supply agreement under which Johnson Matthey will continue to scale the manufacturing of CL2A-SN-38, a key component of sacituzumab govitecan, IMMU’ lead antibody-drug conjugate currently under priority review for accelerated approval as a treatment for patients with metastatic triple-negative breast cancer.
    • Financial terms of the agreement are not disclosed.
    • IMMU shares are up 2% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • ROKU

    Roku +4% on Needham "top pick" (update)

    • Needham names Roku (NASDAQ:ROKU) as a "top pick for 2019" citing over-the-top video growth, strategic position, and demographic reach.
    • Earlier this month, Needham cut Roku to a Street-low target on potential tailwinds from the US-China trade tension.
    • Roku shares are up 4.2% premarket to $28.30.
    • Update with more details:
    • Analyst Laura Martin says one of Roku's "key value drivers" is its acquisition potential but also cites the 24M unique active accounts, which grab nearly 3 hours of viewing time per day per household.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM | 35 Comments
  • GNMK

    GenMark Diagnostics +4% on receiving FDA clearance for ePlex BCID-FP

    • The FDA grants 510(k) clearance for GenMark Diagnostics' (NASDAQ:GNMK) ePlex Blood Culture Identification Fungal Pathogen (BCID-FP) Panel.
    • This panel, together with the ePlex Blood Culture Identification Gram-Positive (BCID-GP) and Gram-Negative (BCID-GN) Panels, were developed for the diagnosis and disease management of bloodstream infections that can lead to sepsis.
    • Shares are up 4% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • NBEV

    New Age Beverages +4% on completing merger with Morinda Holdings

    • New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) closes the merger with Morinda Holdings, a Utah-based healthy beverages and lifestyles company.
    • The transaction closed on December 21, 2018.
    • At closing Morinda will be bringing $25M in working capital. In 2020, New Age may provide up to a $15M one-time payment in either cash or common stock.
    • The newly combined global company will be headquartered in Denver, Colorado.
    • Shares are up 4% premarket.
    • Previously: New Age Beverages announces merger with Morinda, Inc. for $85M, shares up 19% premarket (Dec. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM | 4 Comments

  • Futures add to gains, S&P 500 +1%

    • U.S. stock index futures have been adding to gains through the morning, bringing the S&P 500 to a 1% advance just less than 90 minutes before the open.
    • Nasdaq 100 futures are up 1.1%, and DJIA futures 0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM | 18 Comments
  • CAPR

    Capricor Therapeutics -2% on DMD trial halt

    • Capricor Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CAPR) announces putting its Duchenne muscular dystrophy trial for lead drug CAP-1002 on hold after a safety review following a severe allergic reaction during infusion.
    • The patient was treated and is currently asymptomatic.
    • Capricor is working with the FDA on a mitigation plan.
    • CAPR is down 2% premarket to $0.44.
    • Post updated to correct the link in the first bullet.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM

  • Caterpillar upgraded at Standpoint Research

    • After returning from the holiday, Standpoint Research analyst Ronnie Moas upgrades Caterpillar to Accumulate. Shares are up 1% premarket in response.
    • It's a needed boost for the construction machinery maker, whose shares have fallen 26% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 AM
